title: isolutioncorp
author: isolutioncorp
content: How to convert a  dogecoin hex to WIF key? i tried pywallet, etc...so I can import my WIF key to the wallet?? please help

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: What's the problem you're facing? you need to remember Bitcoin is using byte 80 while Doge is using byte 9E, you also need to calculate the math of SHA256. Both Doge and Bitcoin are using same Base58, maybe you're input wrong numbers or code in your pywallet.I think this link might help you since there's not many different between Bitcoin and Dogecoin https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Wallet_import_format

comments.author: Greg Tonoski
comments.body: Quote from: isolutioncorp on January 24, 2023, 09:18:32 PMHow to convert a  dogecoin hex to WIF key? i tried pywallet, etc...so I can import my WIF key to the wallet?? please helpThere is the script to convert secp256k1 private key in hexadicimal number (HEX) to Bitcoin Wallet Import Format (WIF): https://gist.github.com/GregTonoski/438992249df6e4bd613f9758421ff38a
